column4: Hi, is there a way to get back a file that was deleted through "gksudo nautilus". It never went to the trash, it just deleted it.
it might be in root's trash which is not visible to normal users
you should install etc-keeper for future instances like this. you can get the file back by finding what package it was in and reinstalling it
do you know of any way of getting that file back? It wont let me compile unless the file is there.
i would reinstall the firmware-ralink package
won't work for my card but thanks for helping. bye.
there are other ways to backup... if you want help with some of those just ask
but i reached much the same conclusion about deja-dup and decided that wasn't the backup tool for me
what do you mean other ways? do you suggest another program?
i use rsync
i really only used deja because it supports incremental backups WITH compression
you can do the same with rsync but without the nasty tarballs
cool. ill check out grsync because i dont feel comfortable with the cli version yet
and unless you have lots of big text files im not sure what compression gets you. might be better to put it all on a filesystem that does compression
I see. All i have related to that are books but thats pdf not txt
i dont know what kind of compression ratios you will get with pdfs but its not going to be earth-shattering
okay. so it wouldnt do much for music and video files either?
no
unless you are storing your music as wav files :)
heh. I use flac but thats already compressed. i think i need to read up on compression
long and short is only the first compression is likely to be helpful... unless the first compression is very poor a subsequent compression wont do much
i appreciate your help
